title.narrative: Fonds de contrepartie régionaux de l'Initiative Think tank
Think Tank Initiative Regional Matching Funds

description.narrative:
The Think Tank Initiative (TTI) is a multi-funder program dedicated to strengthening independent policy research organizations in developing countries, enabling them to better provide sound research that informs and influences policy. The program provides core funding and technical support to help grantee organizations achieve their long-term objectives in the areas of research quality, policy linkages, and organizational performance.
This research support project will make an additional source of funding available to help grantee organizations achieve their long-term objectives. The Matching Funds initiative will also promote peer learning, collaboration, and innovation.
The program will accept Matching Funds proposals on a quarterly basis. Proposals must meet the following basic criteria: -demonstrate collaboration between a minimum of two institutions; -concretely connect the project to institutional objectives; -state how and why the proposal is innovative and potentially replicable; and, -articulate, where appropriate, that 25% of project costs will be covered by participating institutions.
Proposals should also outline why the Matching Funds are the best source of funding for these activities, rather than the core Think Tank Initiative grant.
This project will help grantee organizations hire facilitators or coaches to manage and support program activities. It will also allow them to sponsor travel costs and per diem expenses for workshop and meeting participants.
